dialogue: I've got a bad case of something the experts call "sitting disease."
Studies show that people who sit all day for their jobs have a 40% greater chance of dying in the next three years.
Company policy says safety is more important than productivity, right?
So instead of sitting at my desk working, I plan to walk around and drink coffee.
Go sit at your desk or you're fired.
There's a good chance this problem will solve itself within three years.
